cs351.core

Interface Engine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ZombieHouseEngine

    public interface Engine
    The Engine is the driving force behind a game. It ties together all of the critical systems that need to work together (World, SoundEngine, Renderer) and provides an easy interface for accessing them and for updating the game each frame.
    Author:
    Justin Hall

      Runs the next frame.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorld

        World getWorld()
        Returns the game world associated with the engine.
        Returns:
        reference to the game world

      • getKeyInputSystem

        KeyboardInput getKeyInputSystem()
        Returns the keyboard input system to ask which keys are pressed.
        Returns:
        reference to KeyboardInput instance

      • getSoundEngine

        SoundEngine getSoundEngine()
        Returns the sound engine associated with the engine.
        Returns:
        reference to the sound engine

      • getRenderer

        Renderer getRenderer()
        Returns the renderer associated with the engine.
        Returns:
        reference to the renderer

      • getSettings

        Settings getSettings()
        Returns the global engine settings.
        Returns:
        global engine settings

      • getWorldWidth

        int getWorldWidth()
        Gets the world width in terms of tiles.
        Returns:
        width of the world in tiles

      • getWorldHeight

        int getWorldHeight()
        Gets the world height in terms of tiles.
        Returns:
        height of the world in tiles

      • isEnginePendingShutdown

        boolean isEnginePendingShutdown()
        This should be called before each call to frame - if the engine hit the end of the world's level list during the previous frame it will have shut itself down.
        Returns:
        true if it is (game is over) and false if not

      • getNeighboringActors

        java.util.Collection<Actor> getNeighboringActors(Actor actor,
                                                 int tileDistance)
        Returns all neighboring actors to the given actor that are tileDistance away. This includes all objects that extend Actor (including Block and Tile).
        Parameters:
        actor - actor whose neighbors are requested
        tileDistance - distance in tiles around the actor to check
        Returns:
        list of neighbors

      • getPathingData

        boolean[][] getPathingData()
        When this is called, an array of booleans is returned representing all the areas in the map that zombies can walk over. If the value in the board is true, that area is a valid floor tile with no wall obstacle covering it. If it is false then there is a wall sitting on top of it and that spot can't be reached.
        Returns:
        boolean array representing the world

      • init

        void init(javafx.stage.Stage stage,
          World world,
          SoundEngine soundEngine,
          Renderer renderer)
        Initializes the engine and prepares it for the first call to the frame function. Uses whatever values are stored in the settings class.
        Parameters:
        stage - used to setup any callbacks (such as window exit)
        world - World to initialize the engine with
        soundEngine - SoundEngine to initialize the engine with
        renderer - Renderer to initialize the engine with

      • init

        void init(java.lang.String settingsFile,
          javafx.stage.Stage stage,
          World world,
          SoundEngine soundEngine,
          Renderer renderer)
        Initializes the engine with a settings file and prepares it for the first call to the frame function.
        Parameters:
        settingsFile - path to a valid settings file for the engine
        stage - used to setup any callbacks (such as window exit)
        world - World to initialize the engine with
        soundEngine - SoundEngine to initialize the engine with
        renderer - Renderer to initialize the engine with

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Kills the engine. Any future calls to any engine methods (unless init is called again) will result in exceptions.

      • togglePause

        void togglePause(boolean value)
        Allows for pausing and un-pausing of the engine. When paused, calls to frame will not do anything.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the engine should pause and false if not

      • frame

        void frame()
        Runs the next frame. A frame consists of the following: - Check for collisions between actors - Push collision events to appropriate actors - Call the update function for every actor who signaled the need to update - Update the sound engine - Update the renderer - Ask the world for a level reset/a new level if needed
